messages.content: As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name:  I will derive this data from the following paragraph: On August 20, DET. P. Q. Robinson was called to the Northend Warehouse due to suspected smuggling. Key witnesses were Mr. Bryant, the warehouse supervisor, and Ms. Reed, a truck driver. FORWARD COPY TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION. INFORMANT DOCS. Lt. O. P. Grant - OPERATIONS Det. Robinson, Jr. .. INVESTIGATIONS. Detective R. S. Kim and Detective T. U. Lewis assisted with the cargo inspection. VANCE 10:40 Smuggling Mr. Bryant found irregularities in shipment logs, and Ms. Reed noticed suspicious cargo offloading. Container. Technician Paul examined the suspicious cargo. CONTINUED FORWARD TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION 3- STATUS [CHECK ONE] Det. Robinson Jr, Det. Kim, Det. Lewis OPERATIONS Lt. Grant INFORMANT Reed, Kelly 33 Maple Drive, Northend, Maine 145-525. 92260. VANCE 10:40 Smuggling By 1:05 PM, Detectives Robinson, Kim, and Lewis, with Lieutenant Grant, uncovered contraband items. Captain N. O. Wallace coordinated with customs. Sergeant V. W. Reed and Sergeant X. Y. Allen liaised with port authorities. By 3:00 PM, a smuggling ring was identified. FORWARD TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION 3- STATUS [CHECK ONE] Det. Robinson Jr, Det. Kim, Det. Lewis OPERATIONS Lt. Grant AFFIDAVIT - Smuggling Report 1) Shipment Logs 2) Witness Statements 3) F.I.R. 4) Contraband Items List 5) Warehouse CCTV (6) Other Details LINE UP INFO ASSISTANT CHIEF DEPUTY IN CHARGE S. Dixon N.P.D. 13.95 P36 1580 Bryant, JEROME NAME: ADDRESS: TELEPHONE: 95-1872 DETECTIVE: P. ROBINSON ITEM: 36-4600- 90 CRIME: 10:40 IDENTIFICATION NUMBER 81805 - CONFIRMED John Doe DATE 2/20/23 FORWARD TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION CONTINUED.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: DET. P. Q. Robinson  Officer Context: On August 20, DET. P. Q. Robinson was called to the Northend Warehouse due to suspected smuggling. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Lt. O. P. Grant  Officer Context: Lt. O. P. Grant - OPERATIONS Officer Role: Lieutenant Officer Name: Detective R. S. Kim  Officer Context: Detective R. S. Kim and Detective T. U. Lewis assisted with the cargo inspection. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Detective T. U. Lewis  Officer Context: Detective R. S. Kim and Detective T. U. Lewis assisted with the cargo inspection. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Technician Paul  Officer Context: Container. Technician Paul examined the suspicious cargo. Officer Role: Technician Officer Name: Detective Robinson  Officer Context: By 1:05 PM, Detectives Robinson, Kim, and Lewis, with Lieutenant Grant, uncovered contraband items. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Detective Kim  Officer Context: By 1:05 PM, Detectives Robinson, Kim, and Lewis, with Lieutenant Grant, uncovered contraband items. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Detective Lewis  Officer Context: By 1:05 PM, Detectives Robinson, Kim, and Lewis, with Lieutenant Grant, uncovered contraband items. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Captain N. O. Wallace  Officer Context: Captain N. O. Wallace coordinated with customs. Officer Role: Captain Officer Name: Sergeant V. W. Reed  Officer Context: Sergeant V. W. Reed and Sergeant X. Y. Allen liaised with port authorities. Officer Role: Sergeant Officer Name: Sergeant X. Y. Allen Officer Context: Sergeant V. W. Reed and Sergeant X. Y. Allen liaised with port authorities. Officer Role: Sergeant
